Event.name: Receiving_scenario
Event.definition: <def-root>The sequence beginning with the <fen>Recipient</fen> not having the <fen>Theme</fen> and ending with the <fen>Recipient</fen> in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Recipient
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who acts to come into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Donor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person who gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Theme
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that changes possession, beginning in the possession of the <fen>Donor</fen> and ending up with the <fen>Recipient</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The aim of the <fen>Recipient</fen>, which they believe will be accomplished by accepting the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She <t>accepted</t> the ring <fex name="pur">so that his suspicions would not be aroused</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The act that the <fen>Recipient</fen> performs which brings about their reception of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>She received the package <fex name="mea">by signing her name on the delivery certification</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Mode_of_transfer
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The system whereby the <fen>Theme</fen> travels (literally or metaphorically) so that the <fen>Recipient</fen> comes into possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex>I <t>received</t> it <fex name="mod">by e-mail</fex>.</ex></def-root>
